metadata.title: CVE-2024-53061 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:media: s5p-jpeg: prevent buffer overflowsThe current logic allows word to be less than 2. If this happens,there will be buffer overflows, as reported by smatch. Add extrachecks to prevent it.While here, remove an unused word = 0 assignment.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
